004
005package edu.wpi.first.networktables;
006
007import java.util.function.Consumer;
008
009/**
010 * Value change listener. This calls back to a callback function when a value change matching the
011 * specified mask occurs. The callback function is called asynchronously on a separate thread, so
012 * it's important to use synchronization or atomics when accessing any shared state from the
013 * callback function.
014 */
015public final class ValueListener implements AutoCloseable {
016  /**
017   * Create a listener for value changes on a subscriber. This does NOT keep the subscriber active.
018   *
019   * @param subscriber Subscriber
020   * @param eventMask Bitmask of ValueListenerFlags values
021   * @param listener Listener function
022   */
023  public ValueListener(Subscriber subscriber, int eventMask, Consumer<ValueNotification> listener) {
024    m_inst = subscriber.getTopic().getInstance();
025    m_handle = m_inst.addValueListener(subscriber, eventMask, listener);
026  }
027
028  /**
029   * Create a listener for value changes on a subscriber. This does NOT keep the subscriber active.
030   *
031   * @param subscriber Subscriber
032   * @param eventMask Bitmask of ValueListenerFlags values
033   * @param listener Listener function
034   */
035  public ValueListener(
036      MultiSubscriber subscriber, int eventMask, Consumer<ValueNotification> listener) {
037    m_inst = subscriber.getInstance();
038    m_handle = m_inst.addValueListener(subscriber, eventMask, listener);
039  }
040
041  /**
042   * Create a listener for value changes on an entry.
043   *
044   * @param entry Entry
045   * @param eventMask Bitmask of ValueListenerFlags values
046   * @param listener Listener function
047   */
048  public ValueListener(
049      NetworkTableEntry entry, int eventMask, Consumer<ValueNotification> listener) {
050    m_inst = entry.getInstance();
051    m_handle = m_inst.addValueListener(entry, eventMask, listener);
052  }
053
054  @Override
055  public synchronized void close() {
056    if (m_handle != 0) {
057      m_inst.removeValueListener(m_handle);
058      m_handle = 0;
059    }
060  }
061
062  /**
063   * Determines if the native handle is valid.
064   *
065   * @return True if the native handle is valid, false otherwise.
066   */
067  public boolean isValid() {
068    return m_handle != 0;
069  }
070
071  /**
072   * Gets the native handle.
073   *
074   * @return Native handle
075   */
076  public int getHandle() {
077    return m_handle;
078  }
079
080  /**
081   * Wait for the value listener queue to be empty. This is primarily useful for deterministic
082   * testing. This blocks until either the value listener queue is empty (e.g. there are no more
083   * events that need to be passed along to callbacks or poll queues) or the timeout expires.
084   *
085   * @param timeout timeout, in seconds. Set to 0 for non-blocking behavior, or a negative value to
086   *     block indefinitely
087   * @return False if timed out, otherwise true.
088   */
089  public boolean waitForQueue(double timeout) {
090    return m_inst.waitForValueListenerQueue(timeout);
091  }
092
093  private final NetworkTableInstance m_inst;
094  private int m_handle;
095}
